website_summaries.verdict: While not practical for everyone, it's a great concept for users who like the idea of portable seat along with a durable cane.
pros: A lightweight, stable cane that provides added walking security and a handy seat
Tripod legs are easy to open
cons: Though rated for 250 pounds, the weight limit of the seat is questionable
It's too small for many individuals

customer_reviews.title: opens easily, and holds my 5'4" 230 pound body perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This little seat fits the bill. Really lightweight (1.3lbs), not bulky, opens easily, and holds my 5'4" 230 pound body perfectly. I wouldn't push the envelope by wiggling around a lot, but on a flat surface, is comfortable and stable . When you need to sit down a minute, it's a godsend. I bought this model, because I will attach a small (removable) strap through the handle to carry this on one shoulder when I travel or tour. It also has substantial rubber stoppers, where other models have plastic stoppers.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use!
customer_reviews.text: As you can see in the photo, one of the legs broke the very FIRST time I used it! I was just opening it when they leg snapped like a toothpick. Anyone else have this problem. Trying to call the company, but no answer.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: lacking in functionality
customer_reviews.text: Can't really use it for walking, although the chair portion is fine. The problem stems from the grip/handle not being adjustable. Unlike most canes, I am not able to adjust the handle to the proper height, which means that when I walk with it, I am not able to offset weight on the opposite side of my body (one size does not fit all, I am 6'0' tall). Additionally, the hand grip appears to be more for carrying rather than for walking. Recommendation: change the handle grip and also make the upper portion adjustable for better height placement of the grip.
customer_reviews.author: SolarRay

customer_reviews.title: Remain standing
customer_reviews.text: We received our folding chair just in time for our trip to the U.S. Open. Unfortunately, the first time it was used we became aware of the fact that the nut on the bolt that holds the legs together was missing. Luckily, it was noticed before a collapse occurred. It appears that the bolt was too short and therefore not enough room for the entire nut to fit. This was certainly a design flaw and one that could potentially result in an injury to the user.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: This is a well built piece of equipment but it ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built piece of equipment but it is very important to read the instructions on how to use before using and inspect it before each use. It is almost impossible to make something idiot proof but Drive medical has come close. One bolt and one nylon locking nut that may need to be tightened periodically.
customer_reviews.author: dab7400

customer_reviews.title: You can seat anywhere at any time
customer_reviews.text: I love it now I can seat anywhere any time dealing with rheumatoid arthritis is hard and standing for long periods at a time is a killer now I can be prepared for any trips like comic con or girl scout events where there is no seating area I am please with this order 😁
customer_reviews.author: Charity

customer_reviews.title: Worked great to rest when I needed to.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for our recent trip to Universal Studios because I have problems walking long distance and standing for long periods of time. This really helped out when I needed to stop and rest I could just step out of the way and sit. When in a long line for a ride I could sit right there in line when we weren't moving. The only issue with this was if I leaned it against something when it was in 'cain mode', it would easily slide over and fall on the ground. It was a minor annoyance but the reason it got 4 instead of 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: mkztg

customer_reviews.title: Worth its weight in gold!
customer_reviews.text: This little seat is wonderful! Whenever I'm on my feet for a while I experience terrible back pain. Recently an expert landscaper offered to walk my property and make some recommendations. When we went out into the yard, the pain started. Got out the folding seat, and carried it around, sitting on it every time we stopped to discuss a tree or shrub and it saved the day. Probably walked around for an hour and a half and it would have been impossible this handy little "gadget"! I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Blakes

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: I used this once in an airport. Using it properly as instructed on the label, I landed on my backside when the plastic connector that held the seat to the handle ripped. Many fellow travelers helped me up off the floor. I weigh 155 lbs. I can't return it because I had them throw it away at the airport. I was not going to carry a broken cane around. I'm very disappointed and it spoiled my vacation. Id be very cautious buying any Drive products since this was so poorly made - and dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: K. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Major Bolt Broke After 2 Months Use by 170lb User
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk in my all too brief experience. The adjustable legs allow you to spread them so widely that the seat is quite stable. But even folded up it probably won't fit in an overhead bin of an airplane. But that's all irrelevant -- about 2 months after I began using it, the bolt that connects the legs under the seat simply cracked while I was sitting on it. I'm 170lbs. Does anyone involved in the design, manufacture or sale of this product have a sense of responsibility for the safety of its users?
customer_reviews.author: SetterSpeaker

customer_reviews.title: Seat is rock hard and too small to sit on.
customer_reviews.text: Since you can't return Drive Medical products, I will have to donate it somewhere. It was not steady to sit down on without someone nearby; the seat is so hard you couldn't stay there long anyway. I bought the cane with the webbing at the same time, and that works 1000% better.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Questionable sturdiness, may not be good for heavier people.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem very sturdy. I'm 5'4 and 145, doesn't feel really secure. I use it for playing guitar on the street so it gets a lot of use. I do find myself having to balance a bit at first as the legs kind of adjust after sitting.
customer_reviews.author: Revi3wer

customer_reviews.title: NOT ADJUSTABLE!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this because it was not the ADJUSTABLE one as stated in the description. Ordered it for my father-in-law who is 6'4" to take on a vacation to New Orleans. Adjustable legs was necessary for him since he has back issues and can't stand or walk for long periods of time. I accidentally ordered 2 of them, and neither of them were adjustable. I spent a lot of time researching this for him before deciding on this one. Luckily we ordered in advance and he was able to find one that was adjustable from another company before the trip.
customer_reviews.author: Mommyof2

customer_reviews.title: "An excellent product which helps me shop and do other activities!"
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased the "Drive Medical Deluxe Folding Cane Seat" in Black, which I have found to be an excellent portable chair to use. My surprise, was that the central/longer (post) tip's rubber wore out fairly quickly. I had not really expected or thought about that happening quite so fast - just three months "occasional" use. In fairness, perhaps I put too much weight on it?? Regardless, I looked over what Amazon had to offer, found replacement 3/4-Inch Rubber Leg tips!! This is an excellent product and certainly helps me shopping and at other times when I have trouble standing for long.
customer_reviews.author: Carl E. Ahlm

customer_reviews.title: Broke first time used
customer_reviews.text: Broke first time I (200 lbs) sat on it. The retaining ring just snapped and the chair flattened to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Vlad Parpura

customer_reviews.title: Serves the purpose
customer_reviews.text: This cane definitely serves a purpose for me. I can't walk long ways without resting and there are lots of places that just don't have anywhere to sit down. At first I thought the seat would not work at all - that I would break it immediately. So I made my husband sit on it first. It held! It definitely is much better suited for shorter people (I'm 5'6"). It was awkward for my husband to try to sit on it. And it was remarkably sturdy. I don't think you can sit on it and watch your kid's baseball game, but for short stints while you're out and about, it's perfect. It folds very easily. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Watch out--it collapses.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and used it a few times for brief sitting. Used it at the march this weekend, when I was feeling not so good. After about 10 minutes it just collapsed! Dumping me in the street, messing up my back and knee. Fortunately a lot of women at the march helped me get back up. The break occurred in the two shorter legs about 4"-5" down from the seat. the seat did not break. There was no warning about the legs. It would be dangerous for someone more fragile. Even though this model was rated for more weight than mine, it still failed. I ave saved the pieces and would send them to the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: ShapeShifter

customer_reviews.title: I'm 5'11", & 250 lbs.
customer_reviews.text: To short to be a cane, quite delicate to be a chair for a big body. Not to use bird watching over natural unpaved ground. Maybe go with a shooting stick seat? There is a niche in the market for the right product.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Small Seat
customer_reviews.text: My back will start aching when I'm on my feet too long, so I thought I'd give this a try for my last vacation. It was certainly a help, easy to unfold and sit on, but the seat is small (mine not so much), and it was a bit unsteady when on uneven surfaces. I don't really need a cane to help walk, but I had to use this as a cane to have the seating. Kind of a catch 22. Plus, I'd forget the three legs are uneven when it's folded, so doesn't prop up against walls or anything very well when folded. But it does provide portable seating as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie O

customer_reviews.title: Best ever!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a bad knee and back....although I do not need a cane all the times, this one is perfect. It's not heavy; it opens up easily as well as closes and best of all, it's adjustable. I have it on the lowest setting and it's perfect, I'm 5'1"...Thank you Amazon for carrying such a great product and thank you Drive for making it available at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE COLLAPSES
customer_reviews.text: Second time used in a year. First time it held. Second time, didn't see it coming when I was sitting correctly facing forward, the clip that holds it up, snapped and seat collapsed with me on the floor. My knees, which I wanted this to protect, were injured in the process. BEWARE! No indication now of where to notify manufacturer, who for a couple cents more could have used a metal clip in lieu of the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: erbncowgal

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This cane seat is very reliable and it's easy to unfold and refold. I use it frequently while on vacation to avoid long periods of standing. The rubber tips wore out waay too quickly but they were under a lot of frequent pressure! I ordered several replacement tips to carry with me. I am disappointed that when not in use, the cane won't lean against a wall or stand independently. It must lay horizontally. That's a pain, especially when dining, because I have to reach all the way to the floor to store it and to retrieve it.
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: Unsafe for people who cannot alight from a chair without using an assist. This is extremely dangerous for people who have any disability to their legs. More importantly, any balanced issue at all will not not allow for you to stand cleanly. Remember you are straddling this thing. Can you get up from a straddle position? This may be good for people who observe a golf game and would like to sit or someone who gets at at 3AM to boy the new iPhone. BEWARE.
customer_reviews.author: Hedley LaMarr

customer_reviews.title: Needs better portability
customer_reviews.text: I found this item on AMA river trip. I used it often and purchased one. My big complaint - it's not designed to be able to fit in a suit case. Legs can adjust in length so if the same adjustment to the handle rod length using the same push-in buttons it would be perfect. They would sell thousands to travelers stuck in airports when waiting area seating is totally occupied. Anyone traveling on Southwest from Seattle, WA recognizes this problem! I'd give these to friends as a must-have gift if they were more portable. I've already lost one when getting thru lines on cruise ship with luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Lotus lady

customer_reviews.title: This is terrible I bought it for my parents and it broke ...
customer_reviews.text: This is terrible I bought it for my parents and it broke within a month and since there is only a 30 day refund period, I cant do anything about it. My parents way less than 150 pounds, this item said it could stand 250 pounds? It's a lie the screw and bolt came out. I am really disappointed that Amazon lets this sell on here, and it sucks because I bought 2 thinking it would be a good investment. SO NOT WORTH IT!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be what I was looking for. Quality appears good. Will know more after my upcoming trip but works good so far. ... This cane saved my trip! I did over 10,000 steps per day with this cane. When we stopped to listen to our tour guide it was very easy to fold out the seat. I tried walking without the cane a few times and realized it hurt like heck after a few steps, with the cane no pain, so I really did need it. Thank you Drive for making a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Ziesemer

customer_reviews.title: I am hoping this will be useful for waiting in lines for me
customer_reviews.text: I have Charcot Foot arthropathy ( a complication of diabetes ) and need to stay off my feet as much as possible. I am thin and fit and I can barely fit on the seat and don't think it's easy to get up or down! This would be difficult to use for anyone with mobility issues, in my opinion, and it's important to sit still and facing front( the handle goes between the legs) carefully so as not to wobble over. I think a walker with a seat might be safer and more practical long-term; but I'll give it a go as I adjust to my disability.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: its so unstable and too low. No adjustment. I tried this several time but felt as if I would fall and hurt myself. A waste of my money. I should have known it was not going to be good because the price was too low. Not trying that again
customer_reviews.author: Brenda D Brown

customer_reviews.title: If you have excellent elbows, it'll work out fine
customer_reviews.text: It is what it says. It does what it says. It held 275LBS of adult without breaking, but felt as if it might. IT's heavier than a cane without a chair, so it might be hard on the elbows. If you have excellent elbows, it'll work out fine. If not, at least you can use it to get a chair into a place that doesn't allow you to bring chairs, since nobody gives a guy a problem over his cane having extra legs.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Great portable seat
customer_reviews.text: We took this traveling and used it for several lines we were stuck in. It is a lifesaver for people who cannot tolerate standing too long. Because of the chair feature it is not as convenient as a simple cane but then it is designed to be both cane and chair which it does well. Fits in overhead compartments just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and stable
customer_reviews.text: I have mild seizures that I tried at first to use a walking stick...if fell over. Then I bought a quad cane....same result, which actually surprised me. So I decided to order this folding chair...Perfect!! Pros: It's light weight, and easy for me to carry even though I'm 5 ft. And it's about as stable as I need for a quick on-set seizure. Con: If there is one,it would have to be that I was a little mystified on the quickest way to open up the seat before I fell over. So I decided to practice and put a few notes and arrows, etc. so it became more automatic.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: I liked the chair, but it arrived all scratched on the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Keebler

customer_reviews.title: Item as described
customer_reviews.text: Not very sturdy folding cane with folding seat, but handy for some uses because it has a seat. Not adjustable for height, so not a plus for a tall person. I am 5”7” and it is too short for me. Best use would be for when one has to stand in line and cannot stand a long time. Not very portable, a bit awkward to use because of the small seat, which would be inadequate for a large person. One must be careful when sitting on it because it can tip over. A walker with a seat might be much sturdier but takes up a lot more space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: I had to send it back. It is very lightweight, but very unsteady. The seat is very small also.
customer_reviews.author: suzanne egan

customer_reviews.title: Strong, stable, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly strong and light. Provides balance while walking and a place to sit when I need a break. The design allows me to stand up from the seat while holding my balance; I don't need help as I stand up. Helps me survive standing in long lines, inching slowly forward.
customer_reviews.author: JaytheGeek

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband who has a bad back. We were on endless lines at the airport and it came in really. The cane/seat combination was very useful and the whole thing is very strong but light weight. Good for anyone who needs to stand on a long line, or watch a golf match etc. Highly recommended,
customer_reviews.author: SusanNYC

customer_reviews.title: Libhtweight and Very Convenient
customer_reviews.text: This is a genius invention. It is lightweight and comes in handy when waiting in line, waiting for a bus or if you're doing a lot of walking and need to rest. I weigh around 175 and it holds me well. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Paulette Watson

customer_reviews.title: Instant portable seating.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting one of these little cane/seats for quite a while. It increases my mobility. Due to an injury and sciatica I cannot stand too long. Having this with me allows me to walk around and rest as needed without needing to hunt around for a seat when I am in pain. I will add a strap to carry it with me over the shoulder since I do not require a cane to walk most times. UPDATE I have used this seat several times since purchase. Indeed, it has been a lifesaver. I really need to add the strap however, just for convenience sake!
customer_reviews.author: Mother of Twins

customer_reviews.title: Folding cane seat
customer_reviews.text: I love this folding seat cane. The only issue is when using it as a cane, the other legs may get in the way. The other legs do get to the ground, however sometimes on uneven ground it is did help. I used it on a trip to an island in the Chesapeake bay. I was able to sit a couple of time.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Day

customer_reviews.title: A seat. But you'd have to be very, very short to use it as a cane.
customer_reviews.text: I guess I didn't read the description well enough. I assumed (incorrectly ) that the height was adjustable. Description says, "34-38 inches". If it adjusts, I can't figure out how. I'm only 6 feet tall, but this thing doesn't come close to functioning as a cane for someone my height. It's too short. Ergo, it's a seat. Not a very large seat. Not a very comfortable seat. Not a very stable seat. I regret that I didn't return it.
customer_reviews.author: JessMoore

customer_reviews.title: Useful!
customer_reviews.text: Great gadget, comfortable and easy to carry. It’s kind of difficult to keep it standing when it is closed. I’m going to device a strap to attach it to my wrist! Ok
customer_reviews.author: Olga V. Clough

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my requirements
customer_reviews.text: What a great invention! I have trouble standing for a long time if not walking. Simply standing still, for some reason, hurts my back. This gets to be a problem when shopping with my wife and kids as they can look, and look, and look for things for hours. Most stores no longer have chairs or benches any longer other than shoe departments, so this cane is perfect for my needs. It is light enough to carry easily. It unfolds easily. It is completely stable and comfortable when used as directed...facing the handle and straddling it. Not the best perhaps for a young lady wearing a dress or skirt, but otherwise it is completely satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: Old Sparkie

customer_reviews.title: Not safe or stable
customer_reviews.text: Not safe or stable... I purchased this for my dad, Who is not a large man. I tried it out first I only weigh 115 pounds and immediately knew it was an accident waiting to happen. It is not sturdy, the seat wobbles a little and with the three legs you can easily tip backwards I had to return it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Foss

customer_reviews.title: worked out great in the lines
customer_reviews.text: Used at Disneyland, worked out great in the lines. I added a small pillow to the seat and when I carried it around I used a hair tie to keep the legs together so they didn't separate while you walked around. The pillow would push the legs apart so you had to keep them tied.
customer_reviews.author: Grammie B

customer_reviews.title: sad and returned
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband, he did not like the feeling of uneasiness He was worried he would fall and he almost did so it was returned
customer_reviews.author: Baty724

customer_reviews.title: Just what I need
customer_reviews.text: Since COVID Walgreens took away all the chairs. When you are waiting for you turn there are NO chairs. I need the chair to sit. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi J

customer_reviews.title: Works VERY well
customer_reviews.text: I weigh 240 lbs so I was a little worried about this stool. It works GREAT! I sat on it gently, I sat on hard, I ploped on ,I could not break it. I used it to wait in line to vote for three hours. I am so glad I have this now
customer_reviews.author: TNT

customer_reviews.title: Love this little cane chair
customer_reviews.text: Love this little cane chair. I recently purchased it to use when I took my grandchildren to a water park. It was such a relief to be able to sit wherever and whenever I needed to rest my legs from walking and/or standing. It sets up very easily, is sturdy and can also be used as a cane. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Very stable...sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I can walk safely and sit at my wife's grave. Its perfect for this use, very stable even on ground.
customer_reviews.author: M E Curtin

customer_reviews.title: a very handy resting place
customer_reviews.text: I have a foot fracture and needed this to support my non-weight bearing foot. I wasn't sure what to expect but have been pleasantly surprised with this product. I'm 5'5" and the basic height of this cane is perfect. It can be raised for taller people. The seat is small but then again, it wasn't intended for lounging around. It works great while waiting in check-out lines, or if you just need a break during a long-ish trek. My only negative comment is that it was very difficult to raise and lower the seat. We have a can of dry lube and sprayed this on the support where the seat slides up and down. This helped immensely.
customer_reviews.author: bobeau

customer_reviews.title: Great seat.
customer_reviews.text: This seat was a lifesaver. I am 78 and always ride to play golf. Well, I went to watch my grandson play golf in the state championships and had to walk. Ugh. I didn't think I was going to make 18 hole but I did, 2 days in a row. I was thrilled. I wouldn't have been able to do it without the seat. It was easy to carry, light, and easy to sit on.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: It's way too short.
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'3" and this stool is way to short/small for even me. It would be useless to a regular sized person.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for waiting in line
customer_reviews.text: I am tired of standing in line at the Motor Vehicle, small Claims court, so I made the purchase. Also, when I go to the cemetery there is no place to sit so I bring this stool. Worth the money. Good for sitting waiting on line. Easy to fold and easy to keep in car.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best mobile chair ever.
customer_reviews.text: I've been having hip problems, so I'd been using my husband's arm as support. Unfortunately, it didn't help when it became painful walking great distances and there was nowhere to sit down. I even use this when cooking because it's easily moved from place to place.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri

customer_reviews.title: THIS SEAT BROKE ATTEMPTING TO USE IT THE FIRST TIME
customer_reviews.text: THIS SEAT BROKE ATTEMPTING TO USE IT THE FIRST TIME The plastic ring supporting the seat broke on the first attempted use and the seat failed. I fell on the floor bruising my tail bone. Lucky for me I was being careful and did not have my full weight on the seat. The plastic ring is clearly defective. You have been warned about this faulty product order at your own peril.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Basic design flaw could be improved for safety.
customer_reviews.text: Plastic slide split first time I sat on it. Fell on my butt. Well within weight limits Had to metal reinforce plastic slide in workshop but with that mod works fine. Also had to shorten legs to get it to fit in suitcase for airline travel. Otherwise ok.
customer_reviews.author: Doug P

customer_reviews.title: a must for a traveler with a bad-back
customer_reviews.text: This cane/seat meets my need, however, compared with the similar product by Magellan, this seat fits my butt less well and therefore is not as comfortable
customer_reviews.author: kevin marvelle

customer_reviews.title: Loved having a seat!
customer_reviews.text: I loved having this cane because it also doubles as a seat. When I have to do a lot of walking sometimes I need to sit down to rest and this serve the purpose well. It’s quite durable if you just don’t set it on a rocky surface where it has to shift around. I had no problems with it and was thoroughly glad that I had it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: I wish the center leg would be long enough when using as a cane without the others in the way
customer_reviews.author: Seabee Doc

customer_reviews.title: cane that helps one takea break
customer_reviews.text: i got this for a friend who has back problems and has used a cane. she wasnt keen on it initially but we have been traveling and touring and thereare times waiting on line its been perfect. its not too heavy but it is long which we had hoped shecould put the cane in her rolling duffle and use the regular cane only when we knew there would belong waits or lines. it was too long so the other cane got packed for transport. the convenience won out over vanity and my friend sees the value now
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: This is what I was looking for except I wish it would adjust to about 2" higher. The first one broke when I was sitting on it and leaning over, but Amazon did a very fast replacement. If you get it, just sit on it straight. It is light and easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Susan A. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Finally I can walk daily!
customer_reviews.text: This cane is a great idea. I'm petite woman with Rheumatoid Arthritis & herniated back. I love taking this cane with me on my daily walks.. it's easy to carry when not in use. When in use, very easy to use. I love that I can unfold the seat when I need a rest. Very easy & lightweight to unfold & fold back up. This has been a game changer for me as I can walk around the entire block now by myself. Thank you for this invention!
customer_reviews.author: JC from IL

customer_reviews.title: Strangers ask me where I got my cane/chair
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this cane/chair for almost a year and I love it. I prefer to keep the two front legs one notch shorter than the main leg, for stability when sitting and for a more natural rhythm when walking. It's great for taking a walk, very quick and easy to convert when I need to sit down. When standing in line I can leave it configured as a chair and still use it as a cane to advance a few feet. When shopping I throw it in my grocery cart and I don't need to use an electric cart, I can just stop and rest as needed.
customer_reviews.author: carolu

customer_reviews.title: My suggestion is to also buy a four legged cane ...
customer_reviews.text: My suggestion is to also buy a four legged cane conversation base and put it on the long leg. A rubber tip would also work. The tip covers are moulded plastic which is slippery.
customer_reviews.author: Gladys Madness

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY--UNSAFE--NO REFUND IF YOU FALL ON YOUR SWEET PATOOTIE
customer_reviews.text: I sat on the seat and it dislodged from the main unit causing me to fall hard on the floor. I have serious back, spine and knee issues. I could have been seriously injured. Product is not safe and is non-refundable according to Amazon.I rarely do reviews on items that I purchase, but for safety reasons, I wanted to warn anyone considering purchasing this product.Don't buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cane seat. You have to make sure to use it correctly when using for a cane. If you get lazy, it can catch. As a seat, works like a charm. I have taken it to the theme parks in Central Florida while in recovery. During busy times, no problems. I always had a seat when needed. Attraction staff will hold it for you while you ride. I am 5'5" and 210. No problems
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: I have a back pain that comes on after standing ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a back pain that comes on after standing for more than 5 - 10 minutes in one place. I have been using a similar device for more than15 years. I went out of town forgetting to take it with me so. I ordered this one and it works well. I don't leave home without it.
customer_reviews.author: PL

customer_reviews.title: Like it except the seat is too low for someone over 6 ft tall
customer_reviews.text: The seat is too low for my husband. He has an above the knee prosthetic. He's over 6 feet tall, standing from that low is very difficult. Otherwise he is very happy with it. Shopping in stores without motarized carts is difficult. This cane allows him to stop and rest.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver at Disney
customer_reviews.text: Went to Disney and walked 30 miles in 3 days and covered 4 parks. This was a life saver. My only complaint is the seat could become a bit hard since it's plastic with no padding. I'm thinking of retrofitting some memory foam and covering with leather for my next walking adventure.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Good, but need rubber foot replacement
customer_reviews.text: Seat good, height adjustment very handy. Seems a sturdy cane. Rubber foot on main center cane end already needs replacing though I only use 2-3 times a week. Have had cane less than 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hunting buddy
customer_reviews.text: This is great for me hunting. Bad back and Knees prevent me from standing long. The shorter stools and chairs are hard to stand up from. This is perfect to carry and set up for bow hunting. I just painted to camo . Getting old but not giving up!!
customer_reviews.author: Tazz mania

customer_reviews.title: great cane - loved it
customer_reviews.text: Took this cane on vacation. I was afraid that the seat and three legs would prove awkward as I moved around. It was not awkward at all. In fact I felt more secure with the three legs. With the two outer legs just a tad bit shorter then the middle leg, I used it with a rolling motion. The seat came in handy a number times when there was a wait. Glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Jacksonchaka

customer_reviews.title: Good for a short rest
customer_reviews.text: A simple cane is easier to use, but when you have spinal stenosis and can only stay on your feet for so long without sitting down, this cane allows you to be able to go further than you would otherwise be able to by providing you a place for a short rest.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: COMFORTABLE AND STURDY
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE the convenience of being able to sit down no matter where I'm at. I have problems with my legs due to a stroke a few years back. So standing for a long time is not an option. I take my stick EVERYWHERE I GO... And I do mean EVERYWHERE!!! This seat is comfortable, sturdy and lightweight. An absolute lifesaver!
customer_reviews.author: Slim Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great pirchase
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this seat! It is so lightweight yet sturdy. Open and closes easily. Bought it after waiting on line for an extended time to enter a store. Vowed never to stand that long again. Perfect solution!
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: I was the envy of many!
customer_reviews.text: Used at an outdoor fair prior to back surgery. I could have sold about 20 of these from all the people coming up to me and asking where I got it from. A little tricky to sit backwards, but got used to it right away. Nice product
customer_reviews.author: B Miller

customer_reviews.title: Folding Cane
customer_reviews.text: This cane is all that it was shown to be at a reasonable price. It's lightweight, adjustable by height and folds easily. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that the seat is not very large and seems to slant downward rather than straight across. Perhaps I need to adjust it - don't know - but it's only okay (for me) as far as comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: Light and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Light weight easy to carry while herding 28 five year olds to the PE field. Ready for two knee replacements do standing for an hour of their PE time can not be done. This seat dies the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Ryan-Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Can sit in line
customer_reviews.text: This is kinda awkward to walk with. After a while you get used to it. It's nice to be able to sit in a line. Glad i bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Jefflyn Woodley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Just what I was looking for. It is just high enough and sturdy enough for me to sit on and get off of easily. Sitting on it facing the handle, as suggested works great. It is much steadier that way and the handle gives you something to lean on and helps you stand up and get off of it! It's not that heavy or bulky either and it works great as a cane when folded. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret R.

customer_reviews.title: Sit Down Anywhere!
customer_reviews.text: Liked the lightweight nature of the cane. Was able to sit anywhere I needed to without looking for an empty seat. Traveled throughout Europe without worrying about standing up all day. Because of its design, keeping it standing up while not using it is problematic. But, it saved my touring life!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Walking cane/chair
customer_reviews.text: Bought fir my 87 yr old uncle. Says it’s been a life saver. Says he would never make it to the back of Walgreens to get his meds at Pharnacy if it was not for the chair he could stop and rest fir a few.
customer_reviews.author: PamPam

customer_reviews.title: Save that aching back!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t get a DMV appointment & had to stand in line for an hour.....this little jewel came to the rescue! I did tip over once before I figured it out, but sure did beat standing!
customer_reviews.author: Carpet Guy

customer_reviews.title: Came in handy during an over seas trip.
customer_reviews.text: As I am older, this came in handy during my recent tourist trip to Ghana. I rated this 3 stars since unfortunately both of the feet fell off and got lost during my travels so I just removed the third one. One of my guides really liked the cane/chair so much that on my last day in Ghana, I gave it to him. He was so happy!
customer_reviews.author: Aisha

customer_reviews.title: Convenience
customer_reviews.text: I love it it is very handy to take along with me when I have to wait for the cab because I have a lot of arthritis however the seat is not really big enough
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Schell

customer_reviews.title: Good product and serves my needs while out walking for ...
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly as described at your site, well constructed with exception of center attachment main screw. Change out was strongly suggested by one of your purchasers who discovered the flaw (said screw was weak and bent first time of use and feared collapse). I changed this screw for a hardened one with lock tite nut and have had no problem. Good product and serves my needs while out walking for exercise perfectly. Potential purchasers needs remember this unit is not for heavy people.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Cane Seat
customer_reviews.text: This cane seat turned out to be a wonderful asset while on my trip to Ireland. When we were listening to presentations and there were not any seats available, I was able to spare my back and my knee with this item. A few people on this tour asked me where I had purchased the cane seat and they thought that it would have made their trip easier and planned on getting one for future use. The can seat was not expensive and was well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Evalynn

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful!
customer_reviews.text: This was the best purchase for my mom! We would have had a difficult time without it on a recent trip. It was very easy to use and we were able to stop and rest whenever needed. The handle was helpful when standing up. A lady stopped and asked where she could get one. I would highly recommend this for someone who has shortness of breath and/or difficulty with distance. Don't know how well it would work with a back problem. It folds flat but is still cane-length when folded.
customer_reviews.author: Littletigergrad

customer_reviews.title: Hurry up and Wait
customer_reviews.text: So many places to go so long a line. I just decided that for me not to miss out on fun, I would take my own cane/chair. I just decided that for me not to go postal at the post office long lines, I would take my own cane/chair. Long voting lines? Not a problem. No where to sit before a concert? Not a problem. Miserable queue at the airport! Not a problem. The chair is sturdy. Light. Well priced. Takes a little bit of muscle to fold out, and in, the legs but ... not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Handle not adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Didn't seem like it would be sturdy or stable enough for my husband who was recovering from hip surgery. Plus it had no extension on the handle to actually be used as a cane by him (6'1"). No assembly required, which was nice.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Evans

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, made well and the adjustable legs are great ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 87 year old mother who suffered a stroke two years ago. It is light enough to carry with us when we go out so that she can sit down and take a break when she gets tired. Very sturdy, made well and the adjustable legs are great too!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Seat and cane in one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for walking with my dog. Had knee surgery and figured I might need to sit and rest along the trail. Only problem I've had is lifting myself off the seat without arms to hold onto, and balancing myself while closing the legs before moving on.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Beck

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Going to a crowded place? This is perfect to have with you as you can use it to sit down and rest! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR SITTING FOR A SHORT TIME
customer_reviews.text: Uncomfortable if sat in for an extended period. It's obviously not meant for long term sitting, which is why I gave it 5 starts in spite of discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Nai

customer_reviews.title: VERY GOOD for periodic sitting
customer_reviews.text: This is not a permanent seat for sitting. It is very good for those who need a break from time to time walking. Got this for my 92 yr old mother in law and she likes it.
customer_reviews.author: BOCA RICH

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: This is a cane that converts into a seat. I have another similar to it, but another brand, that I have used for years with no problems. The very first time I used this one, it snapped and send me sprawling to the ground. Hopefully this is an anomaly, because it can be very dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: va.buyer

customer_reviews.title: Search for a different seated cane.
customer_reviews.text: Using it as a cane was very cumbersome. The seat is just ok. I actually fell off of it once. I sent it back because it didn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: ukulelemaven

customer_reviews.title: Handy chair cane
customer_reviews.text: This cane has saved me more than once now. It is sturdy enough for me and I weigh 175 pounds. I use it when I am doing visitation in hospitals where a seat is not always available. I also use it when I know I'll be walking long distances or standing for prolonged periods.
customer_reviews.author: carolanne

customer_reviews.title: Folding Chair Cane
customer_reviews.text: This little unit has been a fantastic addition to my yard work. It is light, but strong. I can go into my garden and sit facing the handle and do my planting and weeding. It is just a wonderful idea. Having it so light is great I am enjoying this little unit..
customer_reviews.author: BettyJoyce

customer_reviews.title: works well for sitting
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my wife to take with her on a tour of Europe. It allowed her to sit down while tour guides were talking and not have to stand for a long period which is hard on her back due to her Rheumatoid arthritis. It is not really handy as just a cane since the legs are uneven. You tend to set it down on the first leg, which is a bit shorter, then roll onto the second longer leg and finish by rolling onto the third shorter leg. It tended to make my wife's neck and upper back tight due to the continuous motion of rolling the cane.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Schneider

product_meta.title: Drive Medical Folding Lightweight Adjustable Height Cane Seat
product_meta.description: Style:New ModelThis stylish folding cane seat by Drive Medical provides you with a sturdy support cane when closed and a comfortable seat to rest on when open. This adjustable height cane can be customized to meet your needs and make walking a more enjoyable experience. With strong aluminum construction and a tri pod design with vinyl contoured tipped legs, the cane seat weighs just 1.3 lbs. but can withstand a weight capacity of 250 lbs. Drive Medical strongly recommends this cane for users on the go, as this product is great for travel.
feature_bullets: Provides a comfortable seat to rest on when open, and a sturdy support cane when closed
Manufactured with sturdy, extruded aluminum tubing
Vinyl tipped, contoured legs are strong and stable
Seat Diameter: 9 inch; Seat Height: 19 - 22 inches; Cane Height 34 inch - 38 inch; Seat to floor height 21 inches. Weight Capacity: 250 lbs

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
